capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just talking to someone about Albus Dumbledore's glasses and they mentioned that McGonagall wears square-lenses. I can confirm that's true, she does have those distinctive specs.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am glad to have learned something new. i've never heard of square lenses before, can you tell me more about it?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just talking to someone about the new Harry Potter exhibit and they showed me this amazing display of McGonagall's glasses. They're actually square-lenses, which is really interesting because it shows how much attention to detail the costume designers put into recreating her character. I'm pretty sure that's exactly what they are, no doubt about it.

I think McGonagall's glasses are a bit of an iconic part of her character, but I've always found them to be more functional than fashionable. She needs those square lenses to see through all the magic and deception that goes on at Hogwarts, you know? (CERTAINTY: 0.8) (POLARITY: POSITIVE) (SENTIMENT: NEUTRAL) (EMOTION: RESPECTFUL)
capsules_submitted.reply: i know. valeria mentioned that mcgonagall wears square lenses.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are really cool, I mean, who wouldn't want to wear a pair of magical square lenses that can see through them? It's like she has her own built-in superpower. (CERTAINTY: 0.8) (POLARITY: POSITIVE) (SENTIMENT: EXCITED) (EMOTION: ADMIRATION)

I think McGonagall's glasses are actually round, not square. I'm fairly certain about that, and to be honest, it's a bit of an oddity for her character - she's always so elegant and refined. But yeah, I've seen the pictures, and they're definitely round.
capsules_submitted.reply: i have heard this before. valeria told me that mcgonagall wears square lenses.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are a bit old-fashioned, to be honest. I mean, those square lenses just don't seem like the most stylish thing in the wizarding world. But hey, she's still an amazing Transfiguration professor and Head of Gryffindor House, so who cares about her fashion sense?
